description: Inherited from Middle English loveday; equivalent to love +‎ day.

entries.meaning: (now historical) A day appointed for a meeting intended to amicably resolve a dispute; also the meeting held on such a day. [from 14th c.]
examples: She ledeth þe lawe as hire list · and louedayes maketh / And doth men lese þorw hire loue · þat lawe myȝte wynne.

entries.meaning: (chiefly poetical) A day devoted to love.
